Description: Fragment of terracotta figurine. Head of an old man (?), a cult follower in grotesque style, broken off at neck. Elaborate festival wreath headdress made up of bulbous structured wreath above forehead and further bulbous roll above. Hollow and mould-made, with the back undecorated. Few traces of white coating. Red-brown Nile silt, micaceous with grey core.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Good parallel from Athribis (Tell Atrib) dated to the end of the 3rd century BC (Szmańska 2005, no. 4). Szymańska, H. 2005. Terres cuites d’Athribis. Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.517) (Phase 1)
